course.title: Python A-Zâ„¢: Python For Data Science With Real Exercises!
course.subtitle: Programming In Python For Data Analytics And Data Science. Learn Statistical Analysis, Data Mining And Visualization

reviews.body: Excellent course for someone to learn Python from scratch! The last exercise was very good but lacked explanation in the homework solution tutorials. Nonetheless, I highly recommend this course for someone who wants to enter into the field of data analysis.

its a wonderful course I have enrolled for this course when recommended by an unknown person blindly and at end its awesome and looking forward to complete the datascience A-Z by kiril sir and I think Kiril is the best at datascience and ML
This is a great intro class to understand the key functions of Python. The hands-on exercises help me better practice this language.

Great course with a very passionate lecturer, Thank you Kirill. The only thing that the author needs to polish up to make the course even better is on the explanation of some of the homework solutions by the tutors.

The overall course experience was good but in the bonus lecture, the audio isn't quite good enough. I think it's not your voice krill. Please update it.

Thank you

I am new to Python. This course is exactly what I needed! The basics applied to real life situations. Kirill is amazing! He is a master in sharing his knowledge. This is the third Kirill course that I followed and I must say that the journey is delightful. Cannot wait to start the R course!
This course is good......but the homework sums are not clear
I really enjoyed the course and learned a lot about data analysis. The topics were simply prepared in small sections and it was possible to program everything on the side and gain experience.

This course will get you what needed to start with Python programming to play with data & visualizations for data science. The good thing is this course builds some basic on Python programming before starting with DataFrame concepts which really helps. After this course I jumped on to python document site (https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/) to check my knowledge, was surprised to see most of topics were covered by this course, I was comfortable extending my knowledge to know more about functions/packages. Loved this course, hope you would too.
All the courses from Kirill Eremenko and the SuperDataScience team are excellent and this one is no exception. Highly recommended if you are interested in learning more about the topic.

The end-of-section assignments are videos where the narrator is impossible to understand and is obviously recording these sessions on the fly with NO practice. The rest of the tutorial will give you the code/information needed to learn, but again, the narrator has maybe rehearsed this once and seems to narrate on the fly. If that narrator simply created a script to read off of, this would have been so much better. But it comes off like a high-school book report.

The tutorials by Kiril Elemenco were thorough with useful tips and explanatory clarifications. Section 6 was particularly interesting with useful material for data analysis and eye-catching presentations. However, I expected that the homework challenges for each section should be more relevant to the tutorials of the section. The homework solutions video did not provide sufficient explanations on the method which was selected. The method per se was not always relevant to the tutorials of the section, rather based on the trainer's knowledge and expertise. As a result, it was not made clear for the attendees why they should choose the proposed methodology.

Overall it was definitely a beneficial course and the trainer, Kiril, provided detailed and complete explanation of every line of code.

instructor.name: Kirill Eremenko
instructor.briefIntroduction:
My name is Kirill Eremenko and I am super-psyched that you are reading this!

Professionally, I am a Data Science management consultant with over five years of experience in finance, retail, transport and other industries. I was trained by the best analytics mentors at Deloitte Australia and today I leverage Big Data to drive business strategy, revamp customer experience and revolutionize existing operational processes.

From my courses you will straight away notice how I combine my real-life experience and academic background in Physics and Mathematics to deliver professional step-by-step coaching in the space of Data Science. I am also passionate about public speaking, and regularly present on Big Data at leading Australian universities and industry events.

To sum up, I am absolutely and utterly passionate about Data Science and I am looking forward to sharing my passion and knowledge with you!
